dt-option.summary: Control which cell the order event handler will be applied to in a column
dt-option.description: Allows control over whether DataTables should use the top (`true`) unique cell that is found for a single column, or the bottom (`false` - default) to attach the default order listener. This is useful when using complex headers. Consider for example the following HTML header: ```html 1 2.1 2.2 ``` In this case, when `dt-init orderCellsTop` is `false` (default) the cells `string 1` and `string 2.2` will have the order event listener applied to them. If `dt-init orderCellsTop` is `true` then `string 1` and `string 2.1` will have the order event listeners applied to them.
dt-option.name: orderCellsTop

example.title: Use the top cells in a complex header for ordering
